intro: Lepanthes tsubotae, commonly known as the Tsubota's orchid, is a species of orchid native to Mexico. It is a small, terrestrial orchid that typically grows in shaded, humid environments. The plant features delicate, greenish-white flowers with intricate patterns, often resembling the shape of a miniature orchid. It belongs to the Epidendroideae subfamily and is part of the genus Lepanthes, which includes over 200 species. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, Lepanthes tsubotae is considered a delicate and less commonly cultivated orchid.
